intro: Ternatea mariana, commonly known as the Mariana ternatea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Ternatea mariana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and humid lowlands.
